item.title: Introduction to Distributed Tracing With OpenTelemetry in .NET
item.description: Distributed systems offer flexibility but introduce complexity, making troubleshooting a headache. Understanding how requests flow through your system is crucial for debugging and performance optimization. OpenTelemetry is an open-source observability framework that makes this possible.
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)

item.title: AI Hype - Am I out of work in five years?
item.description: AI is a hot topic - one would say hype topic, and there are bold claims like this: There Will Be No (Human) Programmers in Five Years Source: https://decrypt.co/147191/no-human-programmers-five-years-ai-stability-ceo Now how far is this from reality? Let's take a look at the current state of AI in the context of programming.

item.title: Prologue | Calculus Made Easy
item.description: Considering how many fools can calculate, it is surprising that it should be thought either a difficult or a tedious task for any other fool to learn how to master the same tricks.

item.title: Stop Debugging and Start Running in Visual Studio
item.description: The default way to start or run your application in Visual Studio has always been F5 or the solid green 'play' button. But this attaches a debugger, which is only needed if you're adding breakpoints and stepping through your code. It also can add significant time to the process of running your app. If you're not constantly using the debugger, consider making Ctrl+F5 your default way to launch your apps.
item.author: (Ardalis)

item.title: Vulnerabilities for AI and ML Applications are Skyrocketing
item.description: In their haste to deploy LLM tools, organizations may overlook crucial security practices. The rise in threats like Remote Code Execution indicates an urgent need to improve security measures in AI development.
item.author: (Nathan Eddy)
